result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin T. Moore was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery by Prisoners [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay all costs, surcharges out of up to 25% prison funds and wages. Any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
*Court did not order DNA sample or surcharge.

12-23-2020/ Judge Milton Childs    
The Court ordered that the JOC shall be amended to reflect that the defendant is to serve his sentence on case no. 15CF1170 before he serves his consecutive sentences in case nos. 14CF4071 and 15CF209.
****
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.
Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving nine (9) years Initial Confinement in cases 14CF4071, 15CF209 and 15CF1170.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and  maintain fulltime employment.  Obtain high school diploma or GED.
Mental Health assessment. Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.

No illegal drugs.
No controlled substances without valid prescription.
No contact with drug community.
No contact with the victim Geronimo P.C., and coactor Parris Crossley.
Alcohol and drug assessment.  Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.  No positive results.

supervisions.notes: Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by DOC, but to include:  those as listed.

The Court ordered no DNA sample or DNA surcharge as it has been ordered in case 15CF209.
Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms/body armor or weapons. Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kevin T. Moore in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Kevin T. Moore in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The state has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 2 years, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 1 year with credit for 0 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1 year.

Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:
  
*
Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*No contact with the victim:  Geronimo PC. and co-actor:  Paris Crossley.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Obtain high school diploma or GED.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

- The Court ordered no DNA sample or DNA surcharge, as it has been ordered in case 15CF209.
- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms/body armour or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs, and surcharges, by DOC out of up to 25% prison funds and wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 9 years initial confinement in cases 14CF4071, 15CF209 and 15CF1170.

Appeal rights given.   
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defendant Kevin T. Moore in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Kevin T. Moore in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms/body armour warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.    Defendant was REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department pending sentencing.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Kevin T. Moore not in court, in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for projected guilty plea hearing.  Parties requests new date.  Case adjourned for status conference and projected guilty plea in Branch 26.  Status conference scheduled for October 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Kevin T. Moore not in court, in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant not produced for today's proceedings.    Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 26.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Kevin T. Moore not in court, in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requests Projected guilty plea and sentencing hearing.  Case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 26.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.

Defendant Kevin T. Moore in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Kevin T. Moore in custody.  James C. Griffin for David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant does not challange competency results.  Defense counsel requests Scheduling conference.   Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference, Branch 26.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FOR PURPOSES OF THE COMPETENCY HEARING IN BRANCH 26.

Defendant Kevin T. Moore in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Kevin T. Moore in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense challenging the Doctor's Report dated on today's date.  Doctors Schoenecerk and Lundhohm will appear at the Competency Hearing in Branch 26.  Competency hearing scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Report by Dr. Craig Schoenecker received and filed with court.

Defendant Kevin T. Moore in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Kevin T. Moore in custody.  Lucy Kronforst for David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for April 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Geronimo PC and Co-Defendant Paris Crossley

Defendant Kevin T. Moore in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Kevin T. Moore in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  

Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wis. Stats. Section 165.77(4)

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
OTP
